data.chText: （使）结合，组合，联合，混合
data.enText: to come together to form a single thing or group; to join two or more things or groups together to form a single one

data.chText: 氢与氧化合成水。
data.enText: Hydrogen and oxygen combine to form water.

data.chText: 氢与氧化合成水。
data.enText: Hydrogen combines with oxygen to form water.

data.chText: 几种因素加在一起毁了我们的计划。
data.enText: Several factors had combined to ruin our plans.

data.chText: 把所有的配料放在碗里拌匀。
data.enText: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl.

data.chText: 把鸡蛋和少量的面粉搅匀。
data.enText: Combine the eggs with a little flour.

data.chText: 德国队综合得分为652分。
data.enText: The German team scored a combined total of 652 points.

data.chText: 兼有；兼备；使融合（或并存）
data.enText: to have two or more different features or characteristics; to put two or more different things, features or qualities together

data.chText: 这家旅馆既舒适又方便。
data.enText: The hotel combines comfort with convenience.

data.chText: 这种型号同时具备电话机和传真机的功能。
data.enText: This model combines a telephone and fax machine.

data.chText: 厨房兼饭厅
data.enText: a kitchen and dining-room combined

data.chText: 我们仍在寻觅兼备所有必要才能的人选。
data.enText: We are still looking for someone who combines all the necessary qualities.

data.chText: 他们在这个房间里成功地把古老和现代的风格融为一体。
data.enText: They have successfully combined the old with the new in this room.

data.chText: 同时做（两件或以上的事）；兼做；兼办
data.enText: to do two or more things at the same time

data.chText: 此次旅行将把出差和娱乐结合起来。
data.enText: The trip will combine business with pleasure.

data.chText: 她成功地兼顾了事业和抚养子女。
data.enText: She has successfully combined a career and bringing up a family.

data.chText: 合并；协力
data.enText: to come together in order to work or act together; to put two things or groups together so that they work or act together

data.chText: 他们联手对付共同的敌人。
data.enText: They combined against a common enemy.

data.chText: 两种药物的复合疗效
data.enText: the combined effects of the two drugs

data.chText: 你应该把锻炼和健康饮食结合起来。
data.enText: You should try to combine exercise with a healthy diet.

data.chText: 这项法律的变更来自媒体和公众的通力合作。
data.enText: It took the combined efforts of both the press and the public to bring about a change in the law.
combine harvester

data.chText: 联合收割机
data.enText: a large farm machine which cuts a crop and separates the grains from the rest of the plant

data.chText: 集团；联合企业
data.enText: a group of people or organizations acting together in business

means: 同时做(两件或以上的事)

ex.chText: 悦耳的音乐声和人群的嘈杂声混合在一起。
ex.enText: The pleasant music mingled with noises from the crowd.

ex.chText: 加入草莓，把各种味道混合起来。
ex.enText: Add the strawberry and allow the flavours to mingle.

ex.chText: 她感觉希望和恐惧交织在一起。
ex.enText: She felt hope mingled with fear.

synonyms.bx: 多指无形的东西，如情感、声音、味道等，混合在一起。

ex.chText: 把盐、面粉和肉馅和在一起。
ex.enText: Blend the salt, flour and minced meat.

ex.chText: 先不要加醋，让各种味道调和起来。
ex.enText: Leave the vinegar to allow the flavours to blend with each other.

ex.chText: 他们的音乐把爵士乐和流行音乐融合在一起。
ex.enText: Their music blends jazz and pop.

synonyms.bx: 指（使）柔软或液态的物质，如水、面粉等，调和在一起，或让不同的事物融合起来，使相映成趣或相得益彰。

ex.chText: 你最好把所有的材料放在大碗里拌匀。
ex.enText: You'd better combine all the ingredients in a large bowl.

ex.chText: 水分子是由两个氢原子和一个氧原子构成的。
ex.enText: A molecule of water is formed by combining two atoms of hydrogen and one atom of oxygen.

ex.chText: 他只有9岁，却知道氢与氧化合成水。
ex.enText: He is only 9 years old, but he knows that hydrogen and oxygen combine to form water.

synonyms.bx: 指（使）不同的物质混合在一起形成一种新的物质。

ex.chText: 第一步是把粉末和温水搅拌在一起。
ex.enText: The first step is to mix the powder with warm water.
It is common sense that water and oil don't mix.

synonyms.bx: 指（使）多种物质混合成一种物质，且不容易再被分开。

data.enText: join/combine forces (with sb)

data.chText: （同…）联合；（与…）合作
data.enText: to work together in order to achieve a shared aim

data.chText: 两家公司联合起来争取合同。
data.enText: The two firms joined forces to win the contract.

tr: harvester that heads and threshes and cleans grain while moving across the field
an occurrence that results in things being united
a consortium of independent organizations formed to limit competition by controlling the production and distribution of a product or service
example: they set up the trust in the hope of gaining a monopoly

tr: gather in a mass, sum, or whole
combine so as to form a whole
join for a common purpose or in a common action

example: she unites charm with a good business sense

value.boxr_value: The verb is pronounced /kəm'baɪn/. The noun is pronounced /'kɒmbaɪn/. 动词读作 /kəm'baɪn/。名词读作 /'kɒmbaɪn/。

value.def: If you combine two or more things or if they combine, they exist together.

example.ex: The Church has something to say on how to combine freedom with responsibility...
example.tran: 教会想就如何把自由与责任结合起来发表一下意见。

example.ex: If improved education is combined with other factors dramatic results can be achieved...
example.tran: 如果把改良的教育体系和其他的因素结合起来，会取得非常惊人的效果。

example.ex: Relief workers say it's worse than ever as disease and starvation combine to kill thousands...
example.tran: 救灾人员说疾病加上饥饿夺去了数千人的生命，严重程度前所未有。

example.ex: A stagnant economy combined with a surge in the number of teenagers is likely to have contributed to rising crime levels in the US.
example.tran: 经济停滞不前，加上青少年人数激增，可能是导致美国犯罪率上升的原因之一。

value.def: If you combine two or more things or if they combine, they join together to make a single thing.

example.ex: David Jacobs was given the job of combining the data from these 19 studies into one giant study...
example.tran: 分给戴维·雅格布斯的任务是把这19项研究得出的数据加以综合，使之成为一项大型研究。

example.ex: Combine the flour with 3 tablespoons water to make a paste...
example.tran: 往面粉里加3大勺水揉成面团。

example.ex: Carbon, hydrogen and oxygen combine chemically to form carbohydrates and fats...
example.tran: 碳、氢、氧化合形成碳水化合物和脂肪。

example.ex: Combined with other compounds, they created a massive dynamite-type bomb.
example.tran: 将其与其他化合物结合，就制造出杀伤力极强的硝酸甘油炸弹。

value.def: If someone or something combines two qualities or features, they have both those qualities or features at the same time.

example.ex: Their system seems to combine the two ideals of strong government and proportional representation.
example.tran: 他们的体制似乎是强有力的政府和比例代表制的完美结合。

example.ex: ...a clever, far-sighted lawyer who combines legal expertise with social concern...
example.tran: 兼有法律专业知识和社会责任感的精明而又有远见的律师

example.ex: Her tale has a consciously youthful tone and storyline, combined with a sly humour.
example.tran: 她的故事有意采用富于青春气息的笔调和情节，同时还带些调侃。

value.def: If someone combines two activities, they do them both at the same time.

example.ex: It is possible to combine a career with being a mother...
example.tran: 兼顾职业女性和母亲这两个角色是可能的。

example.ex: He will combine the two jobs over the next three years.
example.tran: 今后3年，他将同时兼顾这两项工作。

value.def: If two or more groups or organizations combine or if someone combines them, they join to form a single group or organization.

example.ex: ...an announcement by  Steetley and Tarmac of a joint venture that would combine their operations...
example.tran: 斯蒂特利公司和泰玛士集团发表的整合其生产经营成立一个合资企业的声明

example.ex: Different states or groups can combine to enlarge their markets.
example.tran: 不同的州或企业集团可以联合起来以扩大市场。

gramarinfo.label: Also V <l>with</l> n, V n <l>with</l> n

value.def: A combine is a group of people or organizations that are working or acting together.

example.ex: ...Veba, an energy-and-chemicals combine that is Germany's fourth-biggest company.
example.tran: 能源化工联合企业费巴是德国的第四大企业
